meanings.definition: A curved blade on a plow that turns over the soil.
meanings.sent1: The farmer attached the moldboards to the plow to prepare the field.
meanings.sent2: The moldboards of the plow helped in turning the soil effectively.
meanings.sent3: The moldboards decided to take a break from plowing and went on a vacation.
meanings.sent4: The moldboards sliced through the earth like a sharp knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The shiny moldboards gleamed under the sun as they worked the land.

meanings.definition: The part of a plow that shapes the furrow.
meanings.sent1: The moldboards left neat furrows in the field after plowing.
meanings.sent2: The farmer adjusted the moldboards to create deeper furrows.
meanings.sent3: The moldboards threw a party for the other plow parts to celebrate a successful harvest.
meanings.sent4: The moldboards guided the plow like a skilled artist shaping clay.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the moldboards cutting through the soil echoed in the quiet countryside.

meanings.definition: A board used for shaping or molding something.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used the moldboards to shape the wood into a beautiful chair.
meanings.sent2: She carefully selected the right moldboards for molding the clay sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The moldboards in the workshop decided to have a race to see who could shape the fastest.
meanings.sent4: Her hands moved swiftly, molding the clay as if guided by the moldboards themselves.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design on the furniture was created using special moldboards.
